title: [BEAM-8106] Separate Java8/11 container image build tasks
body:
Rename existing Java8 docker container and add separate gradle task for Java 11 container This PR: - Splits out docker build tasks into common.gradle - Add new build.gradle for Java8/11 - Changes the runner test tasks to use -PcompileAndRunTestsWithJava11 to determine which test container image is used (Beam worker harness container image does not get inferred from Java 11 version) Follow-up PR will actually add Java 11 container to release and a validateRunner test suite. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-9615] Add schema coders and tests.
body:
Adds some currently demo schema coders and tests for struct types. Does not "hook them up" for use at this time, which will happen in a subsequent PR, with an override setting to allow for migration. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-10703, BEAM-10475] Add an option to GroupIntoBatches to output ShardedKeys. Update Dataflow pipeline translation accordingly.
body:
Add an option to `GroupIntoBatches` transform to output batched input elements associated with `ShardedKey`s. Also adds a default implementation which applies one shard per key. Update Dataflow pipeline translation accordingly. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11143] Ensure that AfterWatermarkStateMachine clears late trigg
body:
er state for merged away windows. Previously the trigger state was cleared with the mergecontext directly which cleared it for the merged-to window namespace, while leaving state in the merged-from window namespaces. Since the merged away windows were then removed from the window set and forgotten, this state could be never cleaned up. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-10409] Remap all PCollections in KeyWithNone elimination
body:
When performing the KeyWithNone elimination, the output PCollections of the original KeyWithNone transforms are deleted, and transforms that read from the deleted output PCollections are remapped to read from the remaining output PCollection. Originally, this remapping was only performed by leaf transforms in stages. This is incorrect because non-leaf transforms may also reference the deleted PCollections. This change fixes this by also applying the remapping to transforms in the context's components. ------------------------ Post-Commit Tests Status (on master branch) ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Lang | SDK | Dataflow | Flink | Samza | Spark | Twister2 --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- Go | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go/lastCompletedBuild/) | --- | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Flink/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Flink/lastCompletedBuild/) | --- | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Spark/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Spark/lastCompletedBuild/) | --- Java | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java/lastCompletedBuild/) | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Dataflow/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Dataflow/lastCompletedBuild/)

title: [BEAM-11130] Exclude OrderedListState category for Dataflow V2.
body:
Refactor how tests are excluded to use the category instead of a regex. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11196] Set parent of fused stages to the lowest common ancestor
body:
Currently the parent of the fused stage is set to `None` if the two stages do not share a common parent. title: [BEAM-10925] Implement Java UDF in ZetaSQL.
body:
Adds jar loading to https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/12398. UDFs are specified by providing a jar to ZetaSQL options; support for SqlTransform::registerUd(a)?f will be added in a later change. title: [BEAM-10124] Compute number of records before each offset using a Multimap sideinput keyed with a filename.
body:
Compute number of records before each offset using a Multimap sideinput keyed with a filename to alleviate memory consumption concerns to materialize side input, see: https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/12924#discussion_r495050059. I am somewhat conflicted about this change since this adds a O(num_read_ranges_in_file) lookup per each row. I thought about using Map > for contextual metadata in the side input, but according to offline discussion with @lukecwik, who is currently OOO, materialization will not work in this case. Happy to follow up if there is a better suggestion to address the existing memory concerns. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: Move Beam 2.25.0 release blog to the correct directory

title: [BEAM-11130] Exclude OrderedListState VR tests from Dataflow V2
body:
OrderedListState tests fail on Dataflow runner v2. Excluding them for now until the feature is supported. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [Beam-4115] Enable Go SDK vanity import path
body:
The purpose of this PR is for review purposes to make progress towards a Go SDK vanity import path. This would enable: ```go import "beam.apache.org/sdks/go/pkg/beam" ``` instead of: ```go import "github.com/apache/beam/sdks/go/pkg/beam" ``` I would like to request @lostluck to review this PR. My questions/comments with this PR are: - I wasn't sure if it made sense to break this into smaller commits. Should I retract this PR and start over? - My experience with htaccess files are limited and I didn't have a good way of testing the changes - It was mentioned in slack that the timing of this PR should wait until BEAM-9615 - Beam Schema Support is complete - Both integration and regression tests passed, yet I did not have success running the [sdks/go/test/run_integration_tests.sh](sdks/go/test/run_integration_tests.sh) on my machine and received the error: `gcloud crashed (TypeError): a bytes-like object is required, not 'str'` - Do the amount of changes associated with this PR, does it warrant updating `CHANGES.md`? ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: Fix URL to BEAM-9615

I would like to request (R: @lostluck ) to review this request. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-11116] Make Java SDK container pull licenses without gradle subprocess
body:
Before: - `:sdks:java:container:pullLicenses` runs a shell script that invokes Gradle at the top level as a subprocess - no artifacts are shared - always has `--rerun-tasks` so it also reruns everything - the two gradle processes overwrite and clobber/corrupt the same artifacts sometimes - seems to do a full java compile of some modules as part of the subprocess (sometimes?) which takes 7.5 minutes on my laptop - finds 80 license files and 22 notice files After: - artifacts are shared - intermediate outputs are cached - no more clobbering - from a clean state takes 1 minute (most of it gradle configuration time) on my laptop - finds 182 license files and 41 notice files, and `diff` shows it is a strict superset (hence safe) - some of these appear to be duplicate pulls, but not all - before and after, this is entirely driven by what deps the `generateLicenseReport` task thinks matter - before it was counting on a global run to cause projects to get configured; after, it is explicitly configuring the project we need. I think afterwards it is more accurate and deterministic, and ready to be refined. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [x] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: Updated shared.py comments
body:
**Please** add a meaningful description for your change here ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11114] BigQueryServicesImpl.isTableEmpty uses jobs.query API

title: BEAM-9094 Configure S3 client for IO to s3 compatible object stores
body:
I would like to be able to configure s3 compatible IO in order to be able to use alternative endpoints. https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/10560 began moving in this direction but has been stalled for a while. The main comment there was that pipeline options should be used for configuration. Some open questions that I have are: * Is there a reason that a separate S3IO instance was created for every operation in the s3filesystem? If so I can save a reference to the pipeline options in the constructor and pass that in instead of saving the single S3IO. * Are there any naming considerations for the S3Options? Should they begin with a naming prefix to differentiate from other options provided on the command line? * Does it make sense to pass in tokens/keys through pipeline options? Should they instead be pulled from the environment? ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [x] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: Sort stages according to data edges as well as must-follows.
body:
Previously it was assumed that all data edges were reflected in must follow edges due to fusion having been performed. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: Adding performance improvements to ApproximateQuantiles.
body:
Improvements include: - Moving min_val and max_val calculation to _QuantileBuffer level, so that unnecessary comparison is avoided most of the time. - Adding fast _interpolate branch for buffers with the same level. - Cythonization of ApproximateQuantilesCombineFn components. - Adding option to process batches of elements. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [x] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-11108] Add a Size method to all Go SDK filesystems.
body:

title: [BEAM-9650] Adding support for ReadAll from BigQuery transform
body:
This adds a DoFn to perform BigQuery exports and pass them downstream to be consumed. Eventually, we'll move `ReadFromBigQuery` to use this as part of its implementation, but for now, we'll leave them separate. r: @chamikaramj r: @tysonjh ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-10632] Make checkerframework qualifiers compile+runtime scope
body:
Two reasons: 1. This allows users to benefit from them. 2. JDK reflection APIs throw NPE when they are not on the classpath. This affects mockito mocking and schema inference, at a minimum. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: Refactoring BigQuery Read utilities into internal file
body:
This is an intermediate step for #13170 , along with #13154 . This change is meant to be pure moving of utilities without changing the functionality. Internal symbols are moved to the interna file. R: @chamikaramj ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: Update Fastjson to 1.2.69
body:
Update Fastjson to 1.2.69, which mitigates a recent security vulnerability applicable to Fastjson 1.2.68. https://www.alphabot.com/security/blog/2020/java/Fastjson-exceptional-deserialization-vulnerabilities.html ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: Change imports of org.codehaus.jackson to com.fasterxml.jackson

title: Implementing Python Bounded Source Reader DoFn
body:
This is valuable for BigQuery repeatedly firing side input. This PR is intended to be used here: https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/13170 This makes the SDF Bounded Source reader available to use. A small change in functionality: - If no `source` is provided to the initial restriction in the constructor, then the element is expected to be a source, and it's added to the initial restriction at creation. r: @boyuanzz ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-11075] Customization of key size and value size
body:
Adds three new methods for `SourceConfigBuilder`: `KeySize`, `ValueSize` and `BuildFromJSON`. This is my first contribution to Go SDK. If anything's missing, let me know! ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11074] Release guide housekeeping.
body:
Multiple small maintenance fixes to the release guide: 1. Remove an outdated checklist item to check the combined javadoc (no javadoc has been created yet). 2. Add a checklist item to have JAVA_HOME set to JDK 8 (the script now checks for this, but it should also be documented). 3. Updated the number of dependencies for Java SDK images. A recent change lowered it. 4. Added an example commit for adding a blog post, instead of just a raw file. 5. Replaced `2.XX` with `{$RELEASE_VERSION}` in the blog post template, for consistency. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11074] Improve process for adding GPG keys to KEYS.
body:
This both adjusts the script so that PMC-hood isn't needed for adding keys to dev/KEYS, and adjusts the instructions in the release guide to add manual instructions for the process, based on the steps in the script. The instructions at the top of the KEYS file (the current recommendation) are a bit obtuse. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: Use a newer Python interpreter version as default.
body:
Java build fails on my machine due to https://github.com/pypa/virtualenv/issues/1910. I suspect several other folks on my team may be affected. The workaround https://github.com/pypa/virtualenv/issues/1643#issuecomment-665703259 does not work since python3.6 distutils package, is no longer installable on my platform. To workaround the issue, bumping up the version to the latest supported. We can readjust or discuss further if this causes any inconveniences. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-9547] Implementation for drop, explode
body:
This PR primarily adds support for `DataFrame.{drop,explode}`. I also noticed an edge case affecting the generated proxy in `rename`, so I included a change in this PR to make `TransformTest.run_scenario` verify that the deferred DataFrame's proxy matches the shape of the expected output. This detected a couple of issues (the aforementioned rename issue, verified in a new test, as well as a problem in `str.repeat`). title: [BEAM-11073] Dicom IO Connector for Java
body:
We are looking to create a new Java Pipeline Connector to help facilitate Reading data from the Imaging API in GCP. Initially, this connector will be used to read study level metadata of Dicom instances. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-10402] Enable checkerframework globally
body:
Instead of opting out whole modules now only existing classes are opted out of type checking. This has the following benefits: - New code will be checked, even in modules that are not yet passing. - Code won't as easily backslide in modules that were partially fixed. - It will produce much more manageable incremental work, and limitless starter bugs! I produced the needed warnings (merged in other PRs) by removing the flag and then repeating the following, more or less: ``` ./gradlew compileJava compileTestJava --continue 2>&1 | tee ~/tmp/gradle.log cat ~/tmp/gradle.log \ | grep -e "$PWD"'.*error:.*' \ | cut -d : -f 1 \ | sort -u \ | xargs grep -L -e '^@SuppressWarnings' \ | xargs sed -E -i '' 's/^(public +)?((abstract|final) +)?(class|interface)/@SuppressWarnings("nullness") &/' ./gradlew spotlessApply ``` There are two ways to still suppress type checking, arguments to `applyJavaNature`: 1. `generatedClassPatterns` to exclude various generated code that is not annotated with nullness types 2. `classesTriggerCheckerBugs` a map from classes which cannot be analyzed to their checkerframework bug URL ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [x] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11068] Ensure beam-sdks-java-bom.pom is signed during release

title: [BEAM-3736] Construct empty global combine values on workers when possible.
body:
------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-9682] Add assign timestamp lesson to Go SDK katas
body:
This pull requests adds a lesson on assigning PCollection timestamps to the Go SDK katas. I would like to request the following reviewer: (R: @lostluck ) The [Stepik course](https://stepik.org/course/70387) has not yet been updated. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11265] Update quickstart-java.md
body:
I don't think we actually want to use the pom.xml as the `inputFile` for the direct runner. You can use the Shakespeare sample, just like with the other runners. **Please** add a meaningful description for your change here ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: More flexible dataframe conversions.
body:
* Allow conversion of a PCollection of primitives (like ints) to a deferred Serries. * Allow conversion of deferred scalars to singleton PCollections without specifying `yield_elements=pandas`. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-11069] Improving performance of file deletion in ReadFromBQ
body:
Current implementation performs a single RPC to GCS for every output file. This makes file deletion often the slowest part of the job. This change allows us to issue deletion requests as batches of 100 files. This change also required updating `gcsio`, which specified the 100-file batching RPC, but did not implement it that way. r: @kamilwu cc: @chamikaramj ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-10940] Lengthprefix any input coder for an ProcessBundleDescriptor.
body:
We need to length-prefix the coder of the input pcollection for one executable stage especially when there is an SDF or a stateful DoFn, where: - In SDF, the input coder is for encoding DelayedBundleApplication - In one stateful DoFn, the input coder is for encoding the key for state request. r: @lukecwik @mxm ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11094] Only work with fully expanded PCollections in TransformHierarchy and PTransformReplacements
body:
While developing #13053 I discovered that some output replacements were not being re-wired correctly. The current types in output replacements would allow false misses when two `PValues` were not expanded to the same degree. Fully expanding all `PValues` to `PCollections` is always allowed, always correct, and eliminates this class of errors. In this PR, I make all the maps only allow PCollections to eliminate that class of error. I also add a bit more testing to transform replacement. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [x] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11067] Update java license script to include source for GNU and Mozilla dependencies
body:
License script was not pulling source for license names that were spelled out. LGPL/MPL worked, but "GNU Lesser Public License" and "Mozzilla Public License" were not matched. This uncovered an issue with module names with upper case characters; fixed by not forcing lower case. Added logging. R: @emilymye R: @Hannah-Jiang R: @robinyqiu ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-9855] Provide an option to configure the Flink state backend
body:
We should make it easier to configure a Flink state backend. At the moment, users have to either: (A) Configure the default state backend in their Flink cluster (B1) Include the dependency in their Gradle/Maven project (e.g. "org.apache.flink:flink-statebackend-rocksdb_2.11:$flink_version" for RocksDB). (B2) Set the state backend factory in the FlinkPipelineOptions. This only works in Java due to the factory specification being in Java! We can make it easier by simple adding pipeline options for the state backend name and the checkpoint directory which will be enough for configuring the state backend. We bundle the RocksDB state backend by default. title: Update go protocol buffers to v2.
body:
Updates Go SDK protos to use v2 of the Go protocol buffer package. This is largely behind the protos existing interfaces, and so is transparent to the SDK's use of them. The proto option go_packages were updated to the fully qualified import names, as the usage we had was being deprecated soon. This lead to some changes to the go generate script that creates the pb.go files. We still require that the beam repo be ensconced in a github/apache folder in a developer's Go path, for proper Go SDK development, but this should be easier to handle if there are other small proto changes needed. Handles renaming the MonitoringInfos rpc from https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/13078 which required small updates to harness/harness.go, this PR will be force updated once that one is in. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable.
